This value represents the price of the in-app purchase, in units of the [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Transaction/currency], that the system records in the transaction. The [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Transaction/price] value reflects all of the following:

The decoded payloads of [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/VerificationResult/jwsRepresentation-21vgo] and the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AppStoreServerAPI/JWSTransaction] strings from the App Store server APIs contain [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AppStoreServerAPI/price] fields specified in *milliunits* of the currency. StoreKit represents the [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Transaction/price] value in *units* of the currency. # price

**Instance Property**

The price of the in-app purchase that the system records in the transaction.

## Declaration

```swift
@backDeployed(before: iOS 17.2, macOS 14.2, tvOS 17.2, watchOS 10.2, visionOS 1.1)
var price: Decimal? { get }
```

## Discussion

This value represents the price of the in-app purchase, in units of the [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Transaction/currency], that the system records in the transaction. The [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Transaction/price] value reflects all of the following:

- The price you configured in App Store Connect, which the system records on the purchase date ([doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Transaction/purchaseDate]).
- The discount from a subscription offer in the [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Transaction/offer-swift.property] property, if the transaction includes an offer.
- The [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Transaction/purchasedQuantity] of a consumable in-app purchase. The price value shows the total amount of the transaction for the quantity that the customer purchased.



The decoded payloads of [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/VerificationResult/jwsRepresentation-21vgo] and the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AppStoreServerAPI/JWSTransaction] strings from the App Store server APIs contain [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AppStoreServerAPI/price] fields specified in *milliunits* of the currency. StoreKit represents the [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Transaction/price] value in *units* of the currency. Take care not to confuse these two representations when working with both APIs.

You configure prices in App Store Connect. For more information, see [https://developer.apple.com/help/app-store-connect/manage-in-app-purchases/set-a-price-for-an-in-app-purchase].

## Getting the product price and currency

- **currency**: The currency of the price of the product.
